block.p: Marla Sue Ribner, a daughter of Beverly Steinman of New London, Conn., and Robert Ribner of Noank, Conn., is to be married today to Andrew Adam Lance, a son of Sheldon Lance of New London, Conn., and the late Charlotte Rosnick Lance. Cantor Richard Botton will officiate at Eolia, a mansion in Harkness Memorial State Park in Waterford, Conn.

The bride, 30, was until recently an associate at Dinkes & Schwitzer, a New York law firm. She graduated from Connecticut College and the New England School of Law. Her father is an accountant in Groton, Conn. Her mother teaches reading at the Tyl Middle School in Montville, Conn.

Marla Sue Ribner, a daughter of Beverly Steinman of New London, Conn., and Robert Ribner of Noank, Conn., is to be married today to Andrew Adam Lance, a son of Sheldon Lance of New London, Conn., and the late Charlotte Rosnick Lance. Cantor Richard Botton will officiate at Eolia, a mansion in Harkness Memorial State Park in Waterford, Conn.

The bride, 30, was until recently an associate at Dinkes & Schwitzer, a New York law firm. She graduated from Connecticut College and the New England School of Law. Her father is an accountant in Groton, Conn. Her mother teaches reading at the Tyl Middle School in Montville, Conn.

The bridegroom, 41, is of counsel to Gibson Dunn & Crutcher, a law firm in New York. He is also the vice president and general counsel of Defender Industries in Waterford, a company that sells marine supplies. He graduated cum laude from Princeton and received a law degree from Yale. His father is the founder and president of the company; the bridegroom's mother was its vice president.
